350.article_body: French makeup and hair expert Florian Hurel, who has worked with the actress Deepika Padukone, spoke about her Cannes 2022 looks. She said, "Deepika is one such actress who is always ready to experiment with her looks...She can pull any kind of look." "You have to be very confident to carry such a look! Hats off to her!" Florian added.

351.title: Some planned to lay down a trap: MNS chief on cancelling Ayodhya trip
351.article_body: After cancelling his visit to Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray said, "Those who were rattled by my announcement to visit Ayodhya were planning to lay down a trap." Addressing a rally in Pune, he added that many people did not like his decision to put the plan on hold.

352.title: 57 pilgrims died since onset of Char Dham Yatra 2022
352.article_body: As many as 57 pilgrims have died since the Char Dham Yatra 2022 began on May 3, DG Health, Dr Shailja Bhatt, said on Sunday. "Health screening of pilgrims is being done on Yatra travel routes," Bhatt added. Earlier, the state government mandated registration for the Char Dham Yatra pilgrims before commencing their journey.

353.title: Expert panel led by IIT prof to probe Ramban tunnel collapse
353.article_body: The Centre has constituted a three-member committee, led by IIT Delhi's Professor JT Shahu, to probe the tunnel collapse incident in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban which killed 10 labourers on Thursday, a government order said. The panel carried out an inspection of the site on Saturday and Sunday and has been asked to submit a detailed report within 10 days.

354.title: Hina unveils poster of 'Country of Blind' at Cannes India Pavilion
354.article_body: Actress Hina Khan unveiled the poster of her second film 'Country of Blind' at the India Pavilion of the 2022 Cannes Film Festival. The film is based on HG Wells' novel of the same name and is directed by Rahat Kazmi. This is Hina's second film poster to be released at the Cannes Film Festival after her debut film 'Lines'.

355.title: We weren't consistent, lost key moments: PBKS head coach Anil Kumble
355.article_body: Punjab Kings head coach Anil Kumble, speaking about his team's IPL 2022 campaign, has said, "The team wasn't consistent." He added, "We...need to find a way to bring better consistency in the coming seasons." PBKS did not qualify for the IPL 2022 playoffs. "We lost key moments...There are a lot of positives, but...disappointed that we couldn't make it," he added.

356.title: Croatian police open fire during clash with soccer fans; many hurt
356.article_body: Croatian police on Saturday opened fire with live ammunition during clashes with soccer fans, who were returning from a match in Zagreb after their team lost, authorities said. The incident occurred when the fans who were travelling in buses under police escort allegedly attacked police officers when the vehicles stopped. Two fans and about a dozen police officers were injured.

357.title: Will consider further cut: K'taka CM after Centre reduces fuel prices
357.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said the state government "will consider" further cut in fuel tax. His statement comes after the Centre on Saturday announced a ₹8 per litre cut in excise duty on petrol and ₹6 per litre on diesel. "I thank honourable PM Narendra Modi...This is a pro-people decision," Bommai had tweeted following the announcement.

358.title: Ukrainian director criticises Cannes for screening Russian film
358.article_body: Ukrainian director Dmytro Sukholytkyy-Sobchuk has criticised the 2022 Cannes Film Festival for including a Russian director in its line-up. While the official Russian delegations were banned from attending, director Kirill Serebrennikov's in-competition film was premiered at Cannes on Wednesday. "When he's here, he is part of the Russian propaganda and they can use him," Sukholytkyy-Sobchuk said.

359.title: Some players take time to understand because it's a new team: Rohit
359.article_body: After finishing their campaign at IPL 2022 with just four wins, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit Sharma has said that some players will "take time" to understand their role because it is a "new team". "This season has been disappointing for us because we could not get a lot of things right during the first half," Sharma said.

360.title: Initially Milind bagged the part of Shekhar in 'Jo Jeeta Wohi...': Deepak Tijori
360.article_body: Actor Deepak Tijori revealed that initially, he wasn't a part of 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar'. "Milind Soman had bagged the part. 75% of the film was shot with him," he said. "Then the makers scrapped the film. It was shut for some time. I knew they had shot it as I had auditioned and I was not selected," he added.

361.title: Raj Thackeray asks PM to change Aurangabad's name to Sambhajinagar
361.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Sunday requested PM Narendra Modi to change the name of Aurangabad to Sambhajinagar. "I request the Prime Minister to bring Uniform Civil Code at the earliest, also bring a law on population control," Thackeray added while addressing a rally in Pune. The Pune Police have imposed several conditions for Thackeray's public rally.

362.title: Depp's lawyer laughs on being asked if she's dating him, video viral
362.article_body: A video showing Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez laughing as a photographer asks her outside the courtroom if she is dating the actor has gone viral online. The photographer can be seen asking her, "Yes or no?" but Camille ignores the question and keeps walking. She also pauses to pet a fan's dog and hugs other fans before moving away.

363.title: Grateful for all the love: Aanand on 7 yrs of 'Tanu weds Manu Returns'
363.article_body: As his film 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' completed seven years of its release on Sunday, director Aanand L Rai said, "It's great to see that 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' has amazing re-watch value." "I'm humbled and grateful for all the love that this film has continued to receive," he added. 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' starred R Madhavan and Kangana Ranaut.

364.title: Foreign national held for cyber fraud in B'luru, 5 fake SIM cards seized
364.article_body: Deputy Commissioner of Police, Anoop A Shetty, took to Twitter to share that the Bengaluru Police have arrested a foreign national who was involved in a cyber fraud using fake SIM cards and bank accounts. The police officer also mentioned in his tweet that five fake SIM cards have been seized from the accused.

365.title: Govt denies reports of ordering ASI to conduct excavation at Qutub Minar complex
365.article_body: After reports claimed that the Ministry of Culture has instructed Archaeological Survey of India to conduct excavation at Qutub Minar, Union Minister G Kishan Reddy said, "No such decision has been taken." This comes after ASI's ex-regional director Dharamveer Sharma claimed that idols of Hindu deities were found in the monument's complex and that it was built by Raja Vikramaditya.

366.title: Major fire breaks out at pharma company in Guj, 10 fire tenders rushed to spot
366.article_body: A major fire broke out in a pharma company in Gujarat's Gandhinagar district on Sunday. Five fire tenders were rushed to the spot after a call about the incident was received at 9 am. "More than five other fire tenders from...Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar, Kalol and Kadi...were also sent," Gandhinagar fire station officer said. Officials said no casualties were reported in incident.

367.title: 400-yr-old public bath found near 'Bibi Ka Maqbara' in Aurangabad, pic surfaces
367.article_body: Remnants of a 400-year-old hammam (public bath) have been found near the 'Bibi Ka Maqbara' (the Taj Mahal's replica) in Maharashtra's Aurangabad. The hammam is located near the entrance of the tomb built by Mughal ruler Aurangzeb in the memory of his first wife Dilras Banu Begum. It might've been meant for use before entering the tomb, ASI officials said.

368.title: Captaincy isn't everyone's cup of tea: Piyush Chawla on Mayank Agarwal
368.article_body: Piyush Chawla has opined that the pressure of leading Punjab Kings was "visible" in Mayank Agarwal's batting in IPL 2022. "The pressure of captaincy is different...it was clearly visible in his batting as well as how he used to look a bit edgy on the field," he said. "Captaincy isn't everyone's cup of tea...it showed clearly here," he added.

369.title: Ashamed this is happening in my country: Kapil Sibal on Neemuch killing
369.article_body: Congress leader Kapil Sibal condemned the killing of a mentally unstable man in Madhya Pradesh’s Neemuch. One man has been arrested for thrashing him to death. "Differently-abled elderly man beaten to death on suspicion of being a Muslim. I am ashamed that this is happening in my country," Sibal tweeted on Sunday.

370.title: IPL betting racket busted in Delhi; 6 arrested, ₹74,740 seized
370.article_body: Delhi Police busted an IPL betting racket operating in Delhi's Nihal Vihar and arrested six persons engaged in it. Police recovered ₹74,740 in cash, 10 mobile phones, two laptops, three internet routers, two LED TVs and other devices from the spot. We acted on a specific input, received by special staff on May 15, to conduct the raid, police said.

371.title: 'Welcome' started off as love story, became comedy during writing: Maker Anees
371.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee, writer and director of Akshay Kumar-starrer film 'Welcome', revealed that the film "started off as a love story back in the day". "But as the writing progressed, it turned out to be a comedy. The story lent itself to all those quirky characters," he added. 'Welcome' also featured Katrina Kaif, Nana Patekar and Anil Kapoor, among others.

372.title: Road widening work on old Mumbai-Pune highway begins
372.article_body: The road widening work on the old Mumbai-Pune highway in Khadki has begun. The work was stalled for several years and now the Department of Defence has given the approval to hand over the two kilometres of land required for the project. The 42-metre wide road is expected to decongest the area.

373.title: Russians to be absent from WEF in Davos for first time since fall of communism
373.article_body: Russian oligarchs and companies will be absent from the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos this year amid the invasion of Ukraine. This will mark the first time since the fall of communism that the WEF will be held without Russian officials or business leaders, Bloomberg reported. The WEF will be held in-person for the first time in two years.

374.title: Stopped 11 child marriages, caught 73 eve-teasers in 2 months: Hyd Police
374.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Saturday that they had averted at least 11 child marriages and apprehended as many as 73 eve-teasers over the last eight weeks. Police further said that the eve-teasers, along with their family members, had received counselling from the authorities. Additionally, police shared a WhatsApp number for people to contact and report eve-teasing cases.

375.title: NCLAT rejects Hinduja Leyland Finance's insolvency plea against Fly Express
375.article_body: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has dismissed the plea of Hinduja Leyland Finance Ltd to initiate insolvency proceedings against its creditor Fly Express Logistics. This comes after the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) rejected the plea in April, saying the date of default, December 24, 2022, falls within prohibition period mentioned in the Insolvency & Bankruptcy Code.

376.title: US Air Force Academy to not commission 3 cadets who refused COVID vaccine
376.article_body: Three US Air Force Academy cadets who refused the COVID-19 vaccine will graduate, but won't be commissioned, the institute's spokesperson said on Saturday. US Air Force Secretary will take the decision on whether the cadets will reimburse the educational costs in lieu of service, the spokesperson added. A fourth cadet has got vaccinated after refusing previously, the spokesperson further said.

377.title: Can't compete with giraffes around me: Aditi on her Cannes red carpet debut
377.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari recently walked the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival 2022, which marked her first appearance at the festival. Aditi said that she's a tiny person who feels comfortable in her body and how she presents herself. "I'm a tiny person...I cannot compete with...the giraffes around me...So I've to be comfortable with who I'm," she added.

378.title: Arrest all policemen involved immediately: Activists on Hyd encounter
378.article_body: Reacting to the SC-appointed panel's findings on 2019 Hyderabad encounter, Telangana Women and Transgender Organisations Joint Action Committee (TWTOJAC) said that all policemen involved should be immediately arrested. TWTOJAC has also sought compensation for families of those killed. The panel found that police staged encounter to kill four persons accused of raping and murdering a veterinarian.

379.title: I stand corrected: Chidambaram on tweets criticising govt after fuel price cut
379.article_body: Congress' P Chidambaram has said the facts of Centre's fuel price reduction are contrary to what he had previously claimed, adding, "I stand corrected." "Entire burden of the reduction falls on the Centre," he admitted. He had earlier said the Finance Minister's exhortation to states is meaningless as 41 paise of a rupee in "central excise" belong to the states.

380.title: You don't discriminate between medallists, non-medallists: 14-yr-old shuttler to PM
380.article_body: During an interaction with PM Narendra Modi, 14-year-old shuttler Unnati Hooda told him, "What motivates me the most is that you never discriminate between medallists and non-medallists." She added, "I have learned a lot in this tournament (Uber Cup). Next time, the women's team also has to win." PM also interacted with the men's badminton team that won Thomas Cup.

381.title: Heard's 'Aquaman 2' role reduced over 'lack of chemistry': Agent
381.article_body: Amber Heard's agent Jessica Kovacevic has testified in the ongoing defamation trial against the actress, saying that her role in 'Aquaman 2' was reduced over her "lack of chemistry" with Jason Momoa. Kovacevic further stated that Heard also lost a role with Amazon due to bad press. Heard is being sued by ex-husband Johnny Depp over her 2018 op-ed article.

382.title: 4 relatives of wife including 1 minor held after man's murder in Hyd
382.article_body: A day after 20-year-old Neeraj Panwar was killed in Begum Bazar in Hyderabad, police have arrested four relatives of his wife, including one minor. The relatives were caught from Karnataka after running away from the city following the murder. Police said that the relatives were provoked by Neeraj's frequent visits to their locality after marrying against their wish.

383.title: Speeding car hits divider on Delhi flyover; woman dead, son injured
383.article_body: A 45-year-old woman died while her son was severely injured after their car rammed into a divider and crashed near a railing on the Satyawati flyover in Delhi's Ashok Vihar, police said. The incident took place early on Sunday morning. Probe is underway and CCTVs are being scanned to ascertain if another vehicle was involved in the accident, police added.

384.title: Bomb squad neutralises bombs found in WB's East Medinipur district
384.article_body: Bomb disposal squad on Sunday neutralised bombs that were recovered from West Bengal's East Medinipur district on Saturday. West Bengal Police said that huge quantity of bombs was recovered, after which, bomb disposal squad had rushed to the spot. News agency ANI had earlier reported that a combing operation was underway after the bombs were found.

385.title: 24-yr-old Delhi engineer goes missing in forest area near Pune
385.article_body: A 24-year-old engineer from Delhi who had visited Duke's Nose Point in Lonavala has been reported missing in a forest since Friday, police said. He had called his brother that he had lost track and later his mobile phone was switched off. Police said that the mechanical engineer had come to Kolhapur for some official work.

386.title: Recovered 3 candles, 4 suicide notes: Delhi Police after bodies of woman, daughters found
386.article_body: The bodies of a 54-year-old woman and her two daughters, aged 27 and 25, were found inside their flat in Delhi's Vasant Vihar. "Police found gas cylinder nozzle was partially opened. Four suicide notes were recovered and three small candles and an angithi were kept there," said DCP (Southwest) Manoj C. "It appears they died due to suffocation," he added.

387.title: Virat Kohli's old tweet thanking Rohit Sharma goes viral after MI send RCB to playoffs
387.article_body: After RCB qualified for IPL 2022 playoffs with the help of MI's victory against DC, an old tweet of Virat Kohli thanking Rohit Sharma went viral. The original tweet was posted by Kohli after Rohit had wished him on his birthday in 2019. On Saturday, Kohli also tweeted a handshake emoji, tagging Mumbai Indians.

388.title: Chulbul Pandey's wish came true: Salman on govt's police initiative
388.article_body: Actor Salman Khan on Saturday took to Twitter to commend the Central Government's new training programme to make the police force across the country more people-friendly and better the image of police personnel. "Ab Chulbul Pandey Ki Aasha Sach hui (Now Chulbul Pandey's wish has come true)," the actor wrote referencing his character from the 'Dabangg' film series.

389.title: Rahul is India's most unsuccessful, frustrated politician: MP CM
389.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is "India's most unsuccessful, frustrated and despondent politician". "No politicians make comments against the country as Rahul Gandhi does on foreign land," Chouhan said after Gandhi on Saturday said India is not in a "good place" at the 'Ideas for India' conclave in London.

390.title: TN to install cloth bag vending machines in public places, IAS officer shares video
390.article_body: Tamil Nadu government plans to install cloth bag vending machines in public places. IAS officer Supriya Sahu shared a demonstration video of the machine wherein she inserted a ₹10 coin in the machine which then dispensed a medium-sized cloth bag. It is being called a Manjapai Vending Machine as manjapai is a multipurpose bag widely used in the state.

391.title: Ricky shares video from B'luru airport at 3.30 am, says 'Pathetic state of immigration'
391.article_body: Two-time Grammy-winner Indian music composer Ricky Kej criticised the immigration process at Bengaluru International Airport. Sharing a video at 3.30 am, he tweeted, "Pathetic state of immigration...Been in line for over an hour now. Currently well over 1,000 people waiting, not all counters working, staff is clueless, inefficient. Why have so many flights, when there is no capacity? @kiranshaw."

392.title: Who is Gama Pehlwan, the undefeated wrestling champion honoured by Google?
392.article_body: Google Doodle on Sunday marked the 144th birth anniversary of Gama Pehlwan, the Amritsar-born wrestler who remained undefeated throughout his international matches and earned the name 'The Great Gama'. The wrestler saved the lives of many people during the Partition of India in 1947. Notably, Bruce Lee was a known admirer of Gama and incorporated aspects of his training routine.

393.title: Benedict to team up with Paul Greengrass for period drama 'The Hood'
393.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch and British filmmaker Paul Greengrass are teaming up for a period drama, 'The Hood'. According to reports, 'The Hood' is believed to be about a peasant uprising in England, and it will follow a farmer, played by Benedict, who becomes the rebellion's commander. Paul is known for directing films like 'The Bourne Supremacy' and '22 July'.

394.title: Punjab CM flags off cycle rally in Sangrur against drug menace
394.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Sunday flagged off a bicycle rally in Sangrur district as part of a campaign against drug menace in the state. "More than 15,000 youth joined the rally...it gives us courage. Your government will not stop till drugs are eradicated," CM Mann tweeted. The enthusiasm of the youth was evident in the bicycle rally, Mann added.

395.title: Calling any actress an item girl is unaesthetic; doesn't sound good: Helen
395.article_body: When asked about her views on item numbers, actress Helen said giving solo dances such a term is "derogatory". "I feel calling any song or actress an item number or item girl is...unaesthetic. It doesn't sound good," she added. "Everyone is a working professional...we shouldn't use the word 'item' to refer to an actress or to any song," she said.

396.title: China increases discounted Russian oil purchases by nearly 50%: Report
396.article_body: China is increasing its purchases of discounted Russian oil, as per shipping data and oil traders. While China had initially refused oil contracts with Russia due to the Ukraine war, it is projected to import 1.1 million barrels per day in May, about 47% up from 750,000 bpd in the first quarter, according to data accessed by Reuters.

397.title: We shouldn't bifurcate: Pooja Hegde on B'wood vs South debate
397.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde, speaking about the ongoing debate on Hindi vs South film industry, said, "We all belong to...same country, it's Indian cinema." She added that people should "stop bifurcating in terms of language". "If [we] get over the subtitle part of watching a film, we'll be open to such...amazing content. It'll make us understand...genuine culture in India," said Pooja.

398.title: We'll never know if these suspects were those who raped and killed Disha: Lawyer
398.article_body: Vrinda Grover, the counsel for the petitioners who asked for a probe into Hyderabad's Disha rape and murder case, said, "We'll never know whether these four suspects were those who raped and murdered the 26-year-old in 2019." This comes after the Supreme Court-appointed panel said that the four accused were deliberately fired upon with an intent to cause their death.

399.title: Administration demolishes 5 houses after police station set on fire in Assam
399.article_body: Houses of five families who were allegedly involved in setting a police station ablaze have been demolished by the Nagaon administration. The police station was set on fire on Saturday over a man's custodial death. The deceased's family claimed that police had demanded a bribe of ₹10,000 and a duck for his release.

400.title: RR's flight faces turbulence, franchise shares video with 'Land Kara De' meme reference
400.article_body: A flight carrying Rajasthan Royals (RR) contingent to Kolkata for their Qualifier 1 match against Gujarat Titans (GT) faced turbulence due to bad weather. "What an experience this flight was, @imjitumoni almost saw god," Riyan Parag wrote on Instagram sharing a picture. RR also shared a video of their journey with 'Land Kara De' meme reference.

401.title: Police knew 2 accused were 15 before shooting them: SC panel on Hyd rape & murder case
401.article_body: The Supreme Court-appointed panel that submitted its findings into the 2019 extra-judicial killings of four people accused in the rape and murder of a Hyderabad veterinarian said that policemen knew two of them were minors. Officials reportedly visited the school of two accused and found that they were both 15 years old, a few days after the rape and murder.
